# quote content: Do one thing every day that scares you.
speaker: Eleanor Roosevelt

# quote content: Truth is powerful and it prevails.
speaker: Sojourner Truth

# quote content: Either I will find a way or I will make one.
speaker: Philip Sidney

# quote content: Joy is what happens to us when we allow ourselves to recognize how good things really are.
speaker: Marianne Williamson

# quote content: To hell with circumstances; I create opportunities.
speaker: Bruce Lee

# quote content: I have no special talent. I am only passionately curious.
speaker: Albert Einstein

# quote content: We cannot hold a torch to light another's path without brightening our own.
speaker: Ben Sweetland

# quote content: Never mistake motion for action.
speaker: Ernest Hemingway

# quote content: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
speaker: Peter Drucker

# quote content: The cosmos is neither moral or immoral; only people are. He who would move the world must first move himself.
speaker: Edward Ericson

# quote content: There are no limitations to the mind except those we acknowledge.
speaker: Napoleon Hill

# quote content: I can't believe that God put us on this earth to be ordinary.
speaker: Lou Holtz

# quote content: Almost everything comes from nothing.
speaker: Henri Amiel

# quote content: Better than a thousand hollow words is one word that brings peace.
speaker: Buddha

# quote content: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
speaker: Albert Einstein

# quote content: Happiness does not come about only due to external circumstances; it mainly derives from inner attitudes.
speaker: Dalai Lama

# quote content: Love is the master key that opens the gates of happiness.
speaker: Oliver Wendell Holmes

# quote content: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
speaker: Oscar Wilde

# quote content: You must do the things you think you cannot do.
speaker: Eleanor Roosevelt

# quote content: We read the world wrong and say that it deceives us.
speaker: Rabindranath Tagore

# quote content: What is a weed? A plant whose virtues have not yet been discovered.
speaker: Ralph Waldo Emerson

# quote content: Truth is generally the best vindication against slander.
speaker: Abraham Lincoln

# quote content: An idea that is developed and put into action is more important than an idea that exists only as an idea.
speaker: Buddha

# quote content: To climb steep hills requires a slow pace at first.
speaker: William Shakespeare

# quote content: Be the change that you want to see in the world.
speaker: Mohandas Gandhi

# quote content: We have committed the Golden Rule to memory; let us now commit it to life.
speaker: Edwin Markham

# quote content: Give thanks for a little and you will find a lot.
speaker: Hausa

# quote content: Let yourself be silently drawn by the stronger pull of what you really love.
speaker: Rumi

# quote content: Wrinkles should merely indicate where smiles have been.
speaker: Mark Twain

# quote content: I do not believe in a fate that falls on men however they act; but I do believe in a fate that falls on man unless they act.
speaker: G.K. Chesterton

# quote content: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
speaker: Lao Tzu

# quote content: Be a good listener. Your ears will never get you in trouble.
speaker: Frank Tyger

# quote content: Things do not change; we change.
speaker: Henry David Thoreau

# quote content: The important thing is this: to be able at any moment to sacrifice what we are for what we could become.
speaker: Charles Dubois

# quote content: The only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing.
speaker: John Powell

# quote content: Things that were hard to bear are sweet to remember.
speaker: Seneca

# quote content: We've got to have a dream if we are going to make a dream come true.
speaker: Walt Disney

# quote content: Compassion and happiness are not a sign of weakness but a sign of strength.
speaker: Dalai Lama

# quote content: Great ideas often receive violent opposition from mediocre minds.
speaker: Albert Einstein

# quote content: A jug fills drop by drop.
speaker: Buddha

# quote content: The wisest men follow their own direction.
speaker: Euripides

# quote content: All the flowers of all the tomorrows are in the seeds of today.
speaker: Ancient Proverb

# quote content: The power of intuitive understanding will protect you from harm until the end of your days.
speaker: Laozi

# quote content: No one has ever become poor by giving.
speaker: Anne Frank

# quote content: Yesterdays home runs don't win today's games.
speaker: Babe Ruth

# quote content: Something opens our wings. Something makes boredom and hurt disappear. Someone fills the cup in front of us: We taste only sacredness.
speaker: Rumi

# quote content: Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be one.
speaker: Marcus Aurelius

# quote content: Bad times have a scientific value. These are occasions a good learner would not miss.
speaker: Ralph Waldo Emerson

# quote content: Knowing your own darkness is the best method for dealing with the darknesses of other people.
speaker: Carl Jung

# quote content: Whatever you are
speaker: be a good one.
